sentences.english: Where do you live?
I live in Tampere with my family.
What street do you live on?
I live on Takamaanrinne.
What kind of house do you live in?
I live in a row house.
Do you live in an apartment building?
No, I live in a row house.
Is there an elevator in the building? What about a garage?

sentences.finnish: Ei, minun talossani ei ole hissiä tai autotallia. Mutta minulla on autopaikka etupihällä.
sentences.english: No, my house doesn't have an elevator or a garage. But I have a parking space in the front yard.
What kind of apartment do you have?

sentences.finnish: Minulla on valoisa mutta pieni neliö.
sentences.english: I have a bright but small apartment.
How many rooms do you have?
I have four rooms.
Do you live alone?
No, I live with my family.
Who do you live with?

sentences.finnish: Minä asun vaimon ja kahden lapsen kanssa.
sentences.english: I live with my wife and two children.
Do you have a dog or a cat?

sentences.finnish: Ei, minulla ei ole koiraa tai kissaa.
sentences.english: No, I don't have a dog or a cat.
Do you have a sauna?
Yes, I have a small sauna.
Does the apartment have a balcony or a terrace?

sentences.finnish: Joo, minun asunnossani on parveke mutta ei terassia.
sentences.english: Yes, my apartment has a balcony but no terrace.
What is in your living room?

sentences.finnish: Minun olohuoneessani on televisio, yksi sohva ja nojatuoli, ruokapöytä ja kirjakaappi.
sentences.english: My living room has a television, one sofa and an armchair, a dining table and a bookcase.
Who is your neighbor?

sentences.finnish: Minun naapuri on perhe, isä, äiti ja heidän tyttö.
sentences.english: My neighbor is a family, a father, a mother and their daughter.
